card.name: City of Brass
card.ability:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004: The damaging ability triggers no matter how the land becomes tapped.

card.name: Crusade
card.ability: White creatures get +1/+1.

card.name: Elvish Champion
card.ability: Other Elf creatures get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
card.flavor:
For what are leaves but countless blades
To fight a countless foe on high.
—Elvish hymn
card.ruling:
10/4/2004: It affects Elves controlled by all players, not just yours.

8/1/2005: This card is now an Elf but has been reworded so that it does not give itself the bonus.

card.name: Elvish Champion
card.ability: Other Elf creatures get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

card.ruling:

card.name: Elvish Lyrist
card.ability: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Lyrist: Destroy target enchantment.
card.flavor: "Make me thy lyre, even as the forest is: What if my leaves are falling like its own!" - Percy Bysshe Shelley, "Ode to the West Wind"

card.name: Giant Growth
card.ability: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

card.name: Glorious Anthem
card.ability: Creatures you control get +1/+1.
card.flavor: Once heard, the battle song of an angel becomes part of the listener forever.

card.name: Glorious Anthem
card.ability: Creatures you control get +1/+1.
card.flavor: The songs of angels are perceived not as words in the ears but as stirrings in the soul.

card.name: Glorious Anthem
card.ability: Creatures you control get +1/+1.
card.flavor: Once heard, the battle song of an angel becomes part of the listener forever.

card.name: Lord of Atlantis
card.ability: Other Merfolk creatures get +1/+1 and have islandwalk.
card.flavor: A master of tactics, the Lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.

card.name: Mad Auntie
card.ability:
Other Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Regenerate another target Goblin.
card.flavor: One part cunning, one part wise, and many, many parts demented.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007: The second ability can target any Goblin permanent except the Mad Auntie whose ability is being activated. It can target a different Mad Auntie.

card.name: Royal Assassin
card.ability: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.
card.flavor: Trained in the arts of stealth, royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004: Can't target itself because you choose the target before you tap him. At that time he is not yet a legal target.

10/4/2004: If the creature is no longer tapped when the Assassin's ability resolves, then the ability is countered.

card.name: Royal Assassin
card.ability: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.
card.flavor: Trained in the arts of stealth, royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force..
card.ruling:
10/4/2004: Can't target itself because you choose the target before you tap him. At that time he is not yet a legal target.

10/4/2004: If the creature is no longer tapped when the Assassin's ability resolves, then the ability is countered.

card.name: Sakura-Tribe Elder
card.ability: Sacrifice Sakura-Tribe Elder: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: There were no tombstones in orochi territory. Slain warriors were buried with a tree sapling, so they would become part of the forest after death.

card.name: Sakura-Tribe Elder
card.ability: Sacrifice Sakura-Tribe Elder: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: There were no tombstones in orochi territory. Slain warriors were buried with a tree sapling, so they would become part of the forest after death.

card.name: Sakura-Tribe Elder
card.ability: Sacrifice Sakura-Tribe Elder: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: There were no tombstones in orochi territory. Slain warriors were buried with a tree sapling, so they would become part of the forest after death.

card.name: Serra Avatar
card.ability:
Serra Avatar's power and toughness are each equal to your life total.
When Serra Avatar is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008: Whether or not the ability triggers depends on if the Avatar has the ability while in the graveyard. If it doesn't (thanks to Yixlid Jailer, for instance), then the ability won't trigger. It doesn't matter whether the Avatar had the ability in its previous zone (it will trigger even if it had been on the battlefield with Humility).

7/1/2012: Serra Avatar's power and toughness are constantly updated as your life total changes.

7/1/2012: The ability that defines Serra Avatar's power and toughness works in all zones, not just the battlefield.

7/1/2012: If Serra Avatar is no longer in your graveyard when its triggered ability resolves, you won't shuffle your library.

card.name: Shard Phoenix
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Sacrifice Shard Phoenix: Shard Phoenix deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.
{R}{R}{R}: Return Shard Phoenix from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
card.ruling:
8/1/2005: You can return Shard Phoenix any time during your upkeep; this is not a beginning of upkeep triggered ability.

8/1/2005: Shard Phoenix uses Last Known Information. If, for example, it was blue when it was sacrificed, the damage will come from a blue source.

card.name: Slith Firewalker
card.ability:
Haste
Whenever Slith Firewalker deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
card.flavor: The Sligh incubate in the Great Furnace’s heat, emerging on Mirrodin’s surface only when the four suns have aligned overhead.

card.name: Slith Firewalker
card.ability:
Haste
Whenever Slith Firewalker deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
card.flavor: The Sligh incubate in the Great Furnace's heat, emerging on Mirrodin's surface only when the four suns have aligned overhead.

card.name: Soltari Priest
card.ability:
Protection from red
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
card.flavor: "In Rath," the priest said, "there is even greater need for prayer."

card.name: Soltari Priest
card.ability:
Protection from red
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
card.flavor: "In Rath," the priest said, "there is even greater need for prayer."

card.name: Thran Quarry
card.ability:
At the beginning of the end step, if you control no creatures, sacrifice Thran Quarry.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004: Triggers at the end of every player's turn.

card.name: Two-Headed Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
{1}{R}: Two-Headed Dragon gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
Two-Headed Dragon can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
Two-Headed Dragon can block an additional creature.

card.name: Volcanic Hammer
card.ability: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Cast the weight as though it were a die, to see a rival's fate.

card.name: Whirling Dervish
card.ability:
Protection from black
At the beginning of each end step, if Whirling Dervish dealt damage to an opponent this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
card.flavor: Amid this whirling hurricane of blades, there is no calm eye in which the hapless can find shelter.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004: If it damages the opponent multiple times in a turn, it gets only one +1/+1 counter at end of turn.
